title: Foundation: Degree in Law, IT, or a Social Science
description: This interdisciplinary role can be approached from several angles. A degree in Law (focus on tech/privacy), IT (focus on data governance), or a social science (focus on ethics/policy) provides a strong starting point.
qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in a relevant field
skills: Understanding of technology's impact on society

title: Gain Experience in a Related Field
description: Work in a field that deals with data, privacy, or compliance. This could be as a lawyer in a tech practice, a data analyst with a focus on governance, or a policy advisor in a think tank. This provides the necessary context for the role.
qualifications: Practical experience with data or policy

title: Specialize in Data Privacy and Ethics
description: Deepen your expertise by obtaining professional certifications in data privacy. This is a crucial step to formalize your knowledge and become a recognized expert. Focus on both international standards and local laws.
institutes: IAPP (International Association of Privacy Professionals) accredited training

title: Data Ethics Officer / Data Protection Officer (DPO)
description: Transition into the dedicated role. As a DPO, you ensure the organization complies with data protection laws. As a Data Ethics Officer, your role is broader, guiding the company on the moral and social implications of its data practices, especially concerning AI and algorithms.
qualifications: Proven experience managing data privacy programs

title: Chief Privacy Officer / Head of Data Governance
description: Advance to a senior leadership position, responsible for the entire data governance, privacy, and ethics strategy of a large corporation. This role reports to senior leadership and the board, shaping how the company responsibly leverages its data assets.
qualifications: Extensive leadership experience in data governance
skills: Building a culture of data ethics
